page.title: 10DOWNTON BRICKWORKS
page.content: THIS IS A SMALL BRICKWORKS EMPLOYING EIGHT PEOPLE AND TURNING OUT ABOUT 3000 BRICKS A DAY. MUCH OF THE WORK IS DONE BY HAND. THE CLAY IS TAKEN FROM TWO SOURCES. STRONG CLAY IS OBTAINED FROM A PIT JUST BEHIND THE BRICKWORKS AND MILDER CLAY IS OBTAINED FROM SANDLEHEATH, ABOUT FIVE MILES AWAY. THERE ARE FOUR KILNS IN USE AT THE BRICKYARD -TWO HEATED BY DIESEL AND TWO BY COAL. EACH ONE HOLDS UP TO 30000 BRICKS. FIRING TAKES A WEEK AND IT TAKES A FURTHER THREE WEEKS TO COOL DOWN. BEFORE EACH FIRING THE ENTRANCE TO THE KILN HAS TO BE BRICKED UP AND SEALED, THEN BROKEN DOWN AFTER FIRING. THE BRICKS ARE SOLD FOR 25_30p EACH. SOME ARE MADE RED IN COLOUR BY ADDING BREEZE AND BRICKS OF VARYING SHAPES ARE MADE FOR SPECIAL ORDERS.
